intro: Sphaeradenia laucheana subsp. irazuensis, commonly known as the Irazu fern, is a member of the fern family Polypodiaceae. It is a small, epiphytic fern that typically grows on tree trunks or branches in humid, shaded environments. The plant has delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a distinctive, often recurved appearance. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the cloud forests of Costa Rica and Panama. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in tropical rainforest ecosystems.
